results.definition: spectacles that are darkened or polarized to protect the eyes from the glare of the sun
examples: he was wearing a pair of mirrored shades

results.definition: relative darkness caused by light rays being intercepted by an opaque body
examples: it is much cooler in the shade
there's too much shadiness to take good photographs

results.definition: a quality of a given color that differs slightly from another color
examples: after several trials he mixed the shade of pink that she wanted

results.definition: protective covering that protects something from direct sunlight
examples: as the sun moved he readjusted the shade

results.definition: a subtle difference in meaning or opinion or attitude
examples: without understanding the finer nuances you can't enjoy the humor
don't argue about shades of meaning
an achievement that puts everything else in the shade
his brother's success left him in the shade

results.definition: a slight amount or degree of difference
examples: the new model is a shade better than the old one

results.definition: a mental representation of some haunting experience
examples: he looked like he had seen a ghost
it aroused specters from his past

results.definition: a representation of the effect of shadows in a picture or drawing (as by shading or darker pigment)
represent the effect of shade or shadow on
protect from light, heat, or view
examples: Shade your eyes when you step out into the bright sunlight

results.definition: pass from one quality such as color to another by a slight degree
examples: the butterfly wings shade to yellow
